channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘I have Type 1 diabetes’: I’m 64 with a $1.3 million 401(k). Is it too late for long-term-care insurance?
item.description: “‘I am married, live in Texas and have no debt other than a mortgage of about $2,200 a month.”

item.title: S&P 500 now more likely to reach 7,200 next year, according to Morgan Stanley’s Wilson
item.description: Better earnings and a steadily high multiple should boost stocks, says Morgan Stanley.

item.title: ‘His income is limited’: Should I pay $800 a month towards my husband’s $67,000 student debt?
item.description: “I have stopped short of paying for his business, his car payment and health insurance.”

item.title: Powell faces his most pivotal test yet: Trump pressure, Fed dissent and a sky-high stock market
item.description: But this week all eyes will be on Powell as he holds a solo press conference Wednesday that will be must-watch TV amid the political drama.

item.title: This researcher finds eerie parallels between now and the pullback of 1998
item.description: Citrini Research warns of market similarities between now and 1998, when markets saw a summer swoon.

item.title: JPMorgan upgrades Nike to overweight, citing a multi-year recover path
item.description: JPMorgan believes that shares of Nike could rise 18% from here.

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts recommend these dividend stocks for regular income
item.description: TipRanks' analyst ranking service discusses three dividend-paying stocks, including EOG Resources and Verizon, favored by Wall Street.

item.title: Stocks Jefferies’ analysts like going into earnings against the Wall Street consensus
item.description: Some stocks Jefferies likes ahead of earnings that haven't felt the love recently include Spotify and Clorox.

item.title: Earnings playbook: Reporting season ramps up with more ‘Magnificent 7’ results this week
item.description: This coming week marks the busiest one of the second quarter corporate earnings season, and some of the world's biggest companies are on the docket.

item.title: Two brokers vie to be Asia’s Robinhood as Hong Kong expands crypto support
item.description: Stock analysts are getting excited about the potential boost to Asian crypto trading after Hong Kong's stablecoin bill takes effect Friday.
